title: Stephen Taft Addresses Shortcomings of Economy in New Book
text:
Author Stephen Taft presents the potential to eliminate financial insecurity for every citizen and still allow the U.S. to be the strongest economic engine in the world in his new book, “ A True Free Market: Conversations on Gaining Liberty and Justice through Economics ” (published by iUniverse). When two long-time friends meet to discuss one’s vision for a different economy, the conversation that ensues sets fantasy against reality. The economic problems of society today are then seen more clearly, and we realize the folly of our economic discourse. But as the conversation progresses, the friends start to see that the fantasy isn’t so far out of reach.
“Capitalism offers the best potential for human flourishing,” Taft says. “While we culturally preach freedom and free markets, we don’t have the rules in place to attain them. We need a different foundation of economic rules if we are to be truly free people, with minimal ties from government.”
Through his book, Taft submits his opinion that capitalism can be done better. His conversational presentation approaches this sensitive topic with diplomacy and conviction. More information is available at http://www.atruefreemarket.com .

About the Author
Stephen Taft graduated from Washington University in Saint Louis in 1980. His adult life has mostly been spent in New York City behind some of the glass walls that line Wall Street, working for major firms such as Lehman Brothers, Morgan Stanley, Paine Webber and UBS.
